interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: VeggieTales: The Wonderful Wizard of Ha's (DVD)
Review Date: 2013/06/19
Store: Brian Roberts  (Director),     Mike Nawrocki  (Actor),     Phil Vischer  (Actor, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family
Product Description: ["VeggieTales: The Wonderful Wizard of Ha's (DVD)", "Meet Darby [Junior Asparagus] who more than anything else in the world just wants to have fun. When he learns about the Wonderful Land of Ha's - an amusement park with all the fixins - and its mysterious wizard who promises to make his dreams come true, Darby is determined to go. Darby decides that nothing is going to stop him and he makes a choice that will change his life forever. Will it be worth everything Darby has given up? Find out in this story of the prodigal son - an over-the-rainbow adventure that reminds kids everywhere that there's no place like home.", ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Animation, Educational', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Phil Vischer, Brian Roberts, J. Chris Wall', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'Phil Vischer, J. Chris Wall', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Absolutely perfect entertainment for the young ones!  If they are old enough to look at the screen, any Veggie Tales product  is a perfect way to spend some family time!
Review Title: Child Perfect!
Rating: 5.0

Johnson, John Ford, James Stewart See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 3 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.66:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Package Dimensions': '7.4 x 5.4 x 0.6 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Director': 'John Ford', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Black & White, Closed-captioned, Dolby, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '2 hours and 3 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 5, 2001', 'Actors': "James Stewart, John Wayne, Vera Miles, Lee Marvin, Edmond O'Brien", 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Paramount', 'Writers': 'Dorothy M. Johnson, James Warner Bellah, Willis Goldbeck', 'Number of discs': '1'} Great movie, fun characters, great message (Right wins out with courage).

Lee Marvin almost stole the movie!

If you love the Duke - add it to your collection.

(Personally, I don't care if the Duke read the Hollywood phone book out loud - it would still be a GREAT movie.) Don't over-think it {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Todd Graff'], 'Producers': ['Michael Nathanson', 'Joseph Farrell', 'Catherine Paura', 'Broderick Johnson', 'Andrew A. Kosove', 'Timothy M. Bourne', 'Queen Latifah', 'Shakim Compere'], 'Starring': ['Queen Latifah', 'Dolly Parton', 'Keke Palmer'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} The movie had a great premise. I thought it would be on the lines of "Sister Act". A clean comedy with joyful music. It was until someone had to interject profanity into the movie for some strange reason. THEN we had choir members sleeping with each other - yeah - that was funny and so very Christian like. It was so sad to see beautiful voices wasted. And Dolly - what were you thinking??

So - turned it off (after we paid to rent it) and read a book..... Could have been great = Slams Christian values Seven Days in Utopia Robert Duvall (Actor), Lucas Black (Actor), Matt Russell (Director) & 0 more Rated: G Format: DVD Movies & TV, Independently Distributed, Drama ["SEVEN DAYS IN UTOPIA follows the story of Luke Chisolm (Lucas Black), a talented young golfer set on making the pro tour. When his first big shot turns out to be a very public disaster, Luke escapes the pressures of the game and finds himself unexpectedly stranded in Utopia, Texas, home to eccentric rancher Johnny Crawford (Robert Duvall). But Johnny's more than meets the eye, and his profound ways of looking at life force Luke to question not only his past choices, but his direction for the future."] {'Genre': 'Drama, Sports', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Lucas Black, Matt Russell, Robert Duvall, Deborah Ann Woll, Jerry Ferrara, Madison Burge, Melissa Leo, KJ ChoiLucas Black, Matt Russell, Robert Duvall, Deborah Ann Woll, Jerry Ferrara, Madison Burge, Melissa Leo, KJ Choi See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 40 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'G (General Audience)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.5 x 5.5 x 7.7 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'ARCE82451DVD', 'Director': 'Matt Russell', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 40 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 29, 2011', 'Actors': 'Robert Duvall, Lucas Black, Melissa Leo, Deborah Ann Woll, Madison Burge', 'Studio': 'Arc Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} Absolutely stunning in its simplicity and truth. A MUST SEE for Fathers, coaches, professionals in all walks of life. Give this as a gift to someone you love! Awesome We're No Angels (1955) Comedy, Romance, Cheerful, Gentle ["In Christmas, three prisoners - Joseph, Albert and Jules - escape from the Devil's Island to a small coastal town in France. They decide to rob a store to get some money and clothes and travel by ship to another place"] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Curtiz'], 'Producers': ['Pat Duggan'], 'Starring': ['Humphrey Bogart', 'Aldo Ray', 'Peter Ustinov']} One of the best Christmas movies to ever come out of Hollywood! The cast is superb, the humor and wit is intensely understated. This is a timeless movie! YAY! profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests:** The user maintains a strong affinity for classic Western films featuring iconic actors and directors, while also enjoying comedic films with musical elements that reflect traditional values. Their recent purchase reflects an interest in family-oriented content, particularly those that promote wholesome, moral stories.

- **Viewing Preferences:** Continues to favor films with strong narratives emphasizing moral themes such as courage and justice. The user remains sensitive to contemporary content that may conflict with their Christian values.

- **Rating Behavior:** Consistently rates films highly (often 5.0), showcasing a discerning approach. Their latest review emphasizes enjoyment of family-friendly entertainment, reinforcing their commitment to content that aligns with their values.

- **Content Engagement:** Enjoys character-driven narratives and becomes frustrated if themes detract from a film's potential. The user is drawn to works that meet high moral standards, particularly in films for children.

- **Collection Mindset:** Demonstrates a desire to build a collection of significant works, especially those featuring beloved actors, highlighting a collector mentality towards classic and family-oriented films.

- **Open-mindedness:** While maintaining a light-hearted perspective on cinema, the user exhibits an increasing appreciation for films blending humor with traditional storytelling, emphasizing integrity and moral themes in their viewing experiences.

Overall, the user seeks films that embody classic storytelling while reinforcing moral integrity, showcasing a blend of classic influences and family-friendly content in their entertainment choices.
